text: Khetrani also called Khetranki is an Indo-Aryan language spoken in northeast Balochistan province of Pakistan mainly in Barkhan district but also in neighbouring districts, it is spoken by the Khetran people. About 200,000 people speak it. Khetrani has grammatical features in common with both Sindhi and with Punjabi, and it sometimes is considered to be mixed language of these both. ==References== Category:Indo-Aryan languages Category:Languages of Balochistan (Pakistan)
title: Khetrani language
